intro: Gnaphalium burchellii, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces a profusion of tiny, white to pale yellow florets arranged in a composite head. Its leaves are silver-gray, covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Gnaphalium burchellii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in dry, sunny conditions.
